com.abmash.api

Class HtmlElements

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<HtmlElement>
          • com.abmash.api.HtmlElements
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<HtmlElement>, java.util.Collection<HtmlElement>, java.util.List<HtmlElement>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class HtmlElements
extends java.util.ArrayList<HtmlElement>
    List of HtmlElement instances.

    Find HtmlElements by using the Browser.query(com.abmash.core.query.predicate.Predicate...) method. The HtmlQuery.find() method returns HtmlElements. See HtmlQuery how to find elements.

    Example:

    • HtmlElement myElement = browser.query().isTitle().isClickable().has("today").findFirst(); directly searches for clickable titles labeled today and returns the HtmlElement
    • See the documentation of HtmlQuery for more examples

    Bulk interactions on all contained elements can be executed by calling the appropriate methods, e.g. type(String) or clear().

    Author:
    Alper Ortac
    See Also:
    HtmlElement, Serialized Form
